Loading...

The Father

by August Strindberg

Other authors: See the other authors section.

MembersReviewsPopularityAverage ratingMentions1863150,489 (3.48)4

The Father is probably Strindberg's best-known play, described as 'great realism' it focusses on the struggles between natural forces. The Father was a turning point for Strindberg, as he subsequently moved to write in a style he described as "artistic-psychological writing". Adapted in this edition by Richard Nelson, a leading playwright and adapter in America, this version was first perfomed at the Roundabout Theatre, New York.… (more)

▾Book descriptions

The Father is probably Strindberg's best-known play, described as 'great realism' it focusses on the struggles between natural forces. The Father was a turning point for Strindberg, as he subsequently moved to write in a style he described as "artistic-psychological writing". Adapted in this edition by Richard Nelson, a leading playwright and adapter in America, this version was first perfomed at the Roundabout Theatre, New York.
